Author: logic_anarchy
Content: Do we need a power-on reset chip?

Author: _luke_w_
Content: A PoR would be nice for future tapeouts. I'm just treating my reset input pad as a PoR.

Author: logic_anarchy
Content: sonst macht das alles kein Sinn im Chip

Author: _luke_w_
Content: tristating all of your outputs when held in reset is pretty common and not just a PoR thing. For example it lets you drive other signals into those PCB traces on your board when you're debugging. If you have two chips on a bidirectional bus and they **both** enable their outputs at reset then that creates drive contention. Etc

Author: _luke_w_
Content: on a real board your chip may be held in reset for some time with its clock stopped while power rails are sequenced
